HR Manager Job at Mill's HR & Talent Solutions




        
    

        
        Mill's HR & Talent Solutions is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Manager 

Job Location: Festac, Lagos (Tuesday-Saturday)
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Beauty & Medical Aesthetics
Gender: Female

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking an experienced HR Manager on behalf of our clientto oversee all human resource functions for our beauty and medical aesthetics business.
	The HR Manager will be responsible for setting up and managing HR structures, ensuring compliance with labor laws, driving performance management, and fostering a strong organizational culture.


Key Responsibilities


	?Set up and manage HR structures and processes, including policies, job descriptions, appraisal frameworks, and promotion criteria.
	Oversee employee lifecycle management: recruitment support, onboarding, performance management, and exit processes.
	?Conduct quarterly and annual performance appraisals for all employees, including line and operations managers.
	Manage payroll, compensation, benefits, leave administration, HMO, and pension remittances.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, tax regulations, and statutory requirements.
	Drive organizational culture, employee engagement, and performance alignment.
	Work closely with the Operations Manager to support business goals while ensuring people compliance.
	Prepare HR reports and provide advisory support to management.


Requirements


	3–5 years of experience in HR operations or HR management.
	Prior experience in the beauty, wellness, spa, healthcare, or medical aesthetics industry is an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labor laws, payroll, tax, and pension regulations.
	Experience setting up HR systems and structures from scratch.
	Strong interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills.
	Ability to work independently and manage the organization’s HR function.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 / month.

Junior Graphics Designer Job at Razley Print Limited




        
    

        
        Razley Print Limited is a top leading Branding and Packaging company with it head Quarter in Abuja.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Junior Graphics Designer
Job Location: Garki, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Junior Graphic Designer supports the creative team in executing design tasks for print and digital projects. This role is ideal for an early-career designer eager to grow technical skills, creativity, and industry experience under supervision.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Assist in creating designs for print and digital materials
	Prepare artwork files for production and printing
	Make revisions based on feedback from senior team members
	Support branding, marketing, and promotional projects
	Maintain organized design files and assets
	Ensure accuracy, quality, and consistency in designs


Performance Expectations


	Timely completion of assigned tasks
	Continuous improvement in design skills
	Accurate and error-free design outputs


Requirements & Qualifications


	OND/HND/B.Sc. in Graphic Design or related field (or equivalent experience)
	Basic proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)
	Basic understanding of typography, layout, and color
	Willingness to learn and take direction


Core Skills & Competencies:


	Creativity and enthusiasm for design
	Attention to detail
	Ability to meet deadlines
	Good communication and teamwork skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@razleyprints.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Candidate works ONSITE.

	Basic knowledge of HR practices and office administration.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to handle confidential information with integrity.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and basic office applications.
	Previous HR or administrative experience is an added advantage.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / month.

Method of Application&nbsp;

HR Assistant Job at Word of Faith Schools




        
    

        
        Word of Faith Schools is the flagship of Christian Education in Africa with a tremendous spiritual and academic heritage, together with abundant opportunities for the maximization of your potential. Word of Faith Schools is a Christian school par excellence with the drive and determination to train up a child in the way he should go so that when he is old he will not depart from it (Pro. 22:6). This is being vigorously pursued through well-defined measures aimed at building character, self-discipline, nobility, and high standards of conduct in the child.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Assistant

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Key Responsibilities


	Support the HR Officer in daily human resource operations.
	Assist with recruitment processes, including receiving applications, scheduling interviews, and maintaining candidate records.
	Maintain accurate and confidential staff files, both physical and electronic.
	Assist with staff onboarding, documentation, and orientation.
	Keep records of staff attendance, leave, and basic welfare matters.
	Help prepare HR documents such as appointment letters, memos, and internal notices.
	Support performance appraisal processes and staff development activities.
	Assist in organizing trainings, meetings, and staff related events.
	Respond to basic staff inquiries professionally and promptly.
	Ensure compliance with school policies and HR procedures.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND, HND, or Bachelor’s degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Basic knowledge of HR practices and office administration.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to handle confidential information with integrity.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and basic office applications.
	Previous HR or administrative experience is an added advantage.


Salary
